meta.title: Architecture — The AI Control Plane | Data Science Technologies
meta.description: Data Science Technologies is designing an AI control plane to govern how AI systems behave in production. Layered architecture for low-latency enforcement, centralized governance, and scalability.
meta.keywords: AI control plane, AI architecture, control plane data plane, runtime orchestration, enterprise AI security architecture

intro: Data Science Technologies is building a control plane designed to govern how AI systems behave in production — not just what they are prompted to say. The architecture is layered to provide low-latency enforcement, centralized governance, and scalability across models and environments.

separation.title: Control Plane and Data Plane Separation

data_plane.title: Data Plane
items: Inline inspection of prompts and actions

hybrid.title: Hybrid Enterprise Deployment
hybrid.description: Separation of control and data planes enables centralized policy management while maintaining localized, low-latency enforcement within customer-controlled environments. This supports hybrid and on-prem deployments without sacrificing governance or performance.

orchestration.title: Runtime Orchestration Layer
orchestration.description: At the center of the architecture is a runtime orchestration layer designed to supervise agentic systems. It authorizes actions before execution, mediates access to tools and APIs, enforces execution-level guardrails, and enables intervention when behavior deviates from expected boundaries.

roadmap.title: Near-Term Roadmap
roadmap.description: We are rapidly iterating on execution-level orchestration capabilities to address the emerging agentic threat landscape. Development is proceeding in close collaboration with design partners to validate behavior, performance, and operational fit before broader availability.
